intro: Hieracium deltophyllum subsp. luescheri, commonly known as the Lüchinger's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, lanceolate, and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a composite inflorescence. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
